H0.text: What Portuguese word for a frenzied homicidal Malay person entered English c.1600s referring especially to a 'running' rioting crowd. Berserk

H1.text: What Portuguese word for a frenzied homicidal Malay person entered English c.1600s referring especially to a 'running' rioting crowd. Maffia

H2.text: What Portuguese word for a frenzied homicidal Malay person entered English c.1600s referring especially to a 'running' rioting crowd. Thug

H3.text: What Portuguese word for a frenzied homicidal Malay person entered English c.1600s referring especially to a 'running' rioting crowd. Amok

A4.text: Amok (dish), a Khmer name for Southeast Asian type of curry steam-cooked in banana leaves

A5.text: Mok language, also known as Amok
